title: How to Make a Phone Camera Into Night Vision

steps.title: You'll want to use a phone you don't need anymore.
steps.content: You'll want to use a phone you don't need anymore. Remember, this hack isn't really reversible so don't do this on a camera you want to use in the future.

steps.title: Use a screwdriver to open the phone.
steps.content: Use a screwdriver to open the phone. Once the phone is open, locate the camera inside.

steps.title: The camera will have an unscrew-able lid where the lens is.
steps.content: The camera will have an unscrew-able lid where the lens is. Unscrew it and remove the plastic containing the lens. Make sure not to let any dust fall onto the shiny CMOS sensor inside. [1] X Research source

steps.title: On the bottom of the part you just removed, you'll find a transparent disc stuck near the lens.
steps.content: On the bottom of the part you just removed, you'll find a transparent disc stuck near the lens. This is the infrared filter. You have to remove this by applying some pressure on it sideways till the glue gives way and it comes off. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Close the camera and close up the phone.
steps.content: Close the camera and close up the phone. Screw the phone back together securely.

steps.title: Buy a couple of IR LEDs or pull one out from an old TV remote.
steps.content: Buy a couple of IR LEDs or pull one out from an old TV remote. Connect the LEDs in parallel to a battery of about 3-5 volts. It's better to use more than one in parallel to spread out the current equally. Test the LEDs by looking at them through any a digital camera. [3] X Research source

steps.title: The phone should be secure inside of the holder.
steps.content: The phone should be secure inside of the holder. You're almost done. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the lights off to test your camera.
steps.content: Turn the lights off to test your camera. You now have an infra-red night vision Camera.
